intro: Hedyotis lanceolata, commonly known as the narrowleaf inchplant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, oval berries that contain the seeds. Hedyotis lanceolata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
